item.title: What to do with Questing Beast Egg in Tainted Grail Fall of Avalon?
item.description:
During their journeys in Tainted Grail: Fall of Avalon , players might have found various mysterious quest items, and they haven't discovered their uses yet. One of such items might be the Questing Beast Egg, found in a well-hidden location in the Horns of the South zone.

This guide will reveal all the information players need to know about the Questing Beast Egg, including its location, value, and most importantly, what they should do with it. First, let's take a look at how to find the correct location to grab this item in Tainted Grail: Fall of Avalon.

Where To Find The Questing Beast Egg In Tainted Grail: Fall of Avalon

The Questing Beast Egg can be found inside the Shrine of a Forgotten God , located on the mountain east of the King's Road. To reach this place, players need to go around the Blood Lake and climb the path next to it, past the Druidic Altar. Then follow the straight path until they see an Archer Lady Statue. Up there, they will find Caradoc once more, and he will question them about their reasons for not revealing that Arthur was still alive inside them.

After exhausting all the dialogue options and then dismissing him, players can move inside the cave. They will be met with the scene of a battle, and a felled beast that was slain by Caradoc himself. Behind this beast, there's a small gap and a Nest, and in the nest lies a single egg. Players should pick it up, then get all the valuables inside the only chest in that dungeon and move as far away as possible before examining the Questing Beast Egg.

Should You Keep The Egg Or Stash It Right Away?

Proceeding forward, there are two options for the players, one leads to the Hatching of the Questing Beast Egg, which will grant them a cute pet (that also involves some backstory and unlocks potential dialogue choices).

The other option is to stash it right away (to prevent it from hatching), and if players do not wish to have a pet or save the creature inside the egg, they should go to their Stash inside the Horns of the South fortress and deposit it there. The Egg can be picked at any time, at which point players will be able to hatch it without any issues.

How To Hatch The Questing Beast Egg

If players have decided to keep the Questing Beast Egg and hatch it, they will need to follow the instructions in the Item, which reveal that after walking 5000 steps, the Egg will hatch . (Yes, that's right, exactly like in the Pokemon games).

Just keeping the Egg in their inventories for a while, and checking it once in a while, will do the trick. Once players see the counter has reached zero , they should rest at a Campfire to see a brief cutscene where the Questing Beast Egg will hatch, and they will have their own pets to accompany them during their journey through the lands of Avalon.

Players can pet the creature, demand it to follow them, or ask it to do 'a trick,' which is actually one of the cutest things this monster can do. Besides that, there's nothing much to it. The creature will not alert enemies while in Stealth, so it is basically cosmetic, except for some dialogue choices with one of the factions (The Picts), the creature will have no intervention in the gameplay.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases Version 3.5 New Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • New Honkai: Star Rail leaks are teasing a pair of new characters coming in the Version 3.5 update, hinting at Hysilens and Cerydra.
  • Hysilens is reportedly set to be a Physical Nihility character with a maid-like appearance, while Cerydra will debut as a Wind Harmony unit.
  • Honkai: Star Rail is gearing up for its first major crossover, with Version 3.4 bringing the long-awaited collaboration with Fate/Stay Night .

A recent leak from Honkai: Star Rail is hinting at two characters set to make their playable debut in the Version 3.5 update, including the long-rumored Hysilens. The sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse has introduced a plethora of new characters to the game's roster since the newest playable world of Amphoreus debuted earlier this year, with more on the way. The developer has already revealed three new characters coming to the game in Version 3.4, including major Amphoreus character Phainon and Archer and Saber with the Fate/Stay Night collaboration. Now, even more new cast members are being teased.

The newest world added to Honkai: Star Rail already boasts a sizable roster of playable characters for players to acquire through the game's gacha system. Amphoreus has added several characters who have made a major impact on the game's meta, with roster members like The Herta and Castorice immediately becoming some of the game's top units. Others like Tribbie and Hyacine have become popular support options for teams, alongside more niche characters like Anaxa. A new leak is now hinting at even more characters coming soon.

Honkai: Star Rail Leak Hints at New Characters Hysilens and Cerydra

A leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Luna is teasing two new characters in Honkai: Star Rail's Version 3.5. The post suggests that Hysilens will finally make her long-rumored debut within Honkai: Star Rail , arriving as a Physical Nihility character and sporting a "Maid"-themed model. Version 3.5 is also said to be adding Cerydra to the game as a new character, debuting as a Wind Harmony unit with the "Girl" model similar to the model used by Fu Xuan. Honkai: Star Rail 's Version 3.5 update is currently expected to launch in August.

  • Hysilens : Physical Nihility character, "Maid" model
  • Cerydra : Wind Harmony character, "Girl" model

Honkai: Star Rail 's rumored new characters come as several of the game's older characters are set to receive some helpful boosts in the near future. HoYoverse confirmed it will be rolling out buffs to four of Honkai: Star Rail 's older characters as part of the Version 3.4 update, with Silver Wolf, Blade, Kafka, and Jingliu all set to receive boosts during the patch. Leaks have even begun to hint at some of the specific changes coming, with Jingliu and Blade having their scalings changed to be HP-based and Silver Wolf seeing adjustments to her Skills.

Honkai: Star Rail looks to have plenty of exciting updates on the way with the story of Amphoreus reaching its climax during Version 3.3. The following Version 3.4 update will welcome the launch of the previously-mentioned Fate/Stay Night collaboration, whisking players back to Penacony for the "Penaconian Holy Grail War." Leaks have also teased the arrival of a brand-new skin to the game, with fan-favorite character Firefly reportedly receiving her own skin in Version 3.4. Honkai: Star Rail 's cast of characters are in for some major updates in the game's near future.

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals Redesign of Classic Skin is Coming
item.description:
Summary

  • A redeigned version of the iconic Fortnite character The Visitor could arrive on June 7.
  • A free Burnoff skin is available to Fortnite players by logging into the app on mobile.
  • It was recently leaked that a live event could be taking place in Fortnite on June 7.

A prominent Fortnite leaker has revealed that a redesigned version of the classic character The Visitor could be coming to Epic Games' popular battle royale on June 7. Fortnite recently launched its first Star Wars -themed mini-season called Galactic Battle, which has added iconic characters like General Grievous, Emperor Palpatine, and Mace Windu to the game.

Epic Games recently revealed that players can earn a free skin in Fortnite by downloading the game on one of their mobile devices and logging in. The free cosmetic is meant to celebrate the return of the battle royale to Apple devices in the United States, though the offer is available to players on both Apple and Android devices worldwide. The skin up for grabs is called Burnoff and features a woman wearing a black and red motorcycle racing outfit with a helmet that can be removed. The offer will be available to all players before June 17, at which point players will no longer be able to claim the outfit for free.

In a recent post on Twitter, the popular leaker ShiinaBR shared a picture of a blurry icon that looks like The Visitor next to an image of the original skin. According to them, this icon is teasing the arrival of a new version of The Visitor, which could be coming to the game on June 7. The Visitor has a long history in the battle royale, as he was originally part of the Chapter 1 Season 4 battle pass. At one point, there were even voice recordings of The Visitor in Fortnite , which were scattered around the map for players to find.

The Visitor Could Be Getting a Redesign in Fortnite

June 7 could be a big day for Fortnite fans, as it was recently leaked that the next live event might be taking place on that day as well. It seems as if the event will be the grand finale of the battle royale's Galactic Battle mini-season. According to leaks, the event will likely involve having players participate in sabotaging the Death Star, which has been looming over the map since the beginning of the Star Wars -themed season.

Currently, gamers also have the ability to earn a free Iridia Vayne skin in Fortnite by completing its Party Up: Celestial Strike quests by June 7. In order to earn the cosmetic, players will need to earn XP across both Epic-published and creator-published experiences while partied up with friends. With so much content to enjoy and even more on the way, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Fortnite .

item.title: Rumor: Nintendo Direct Could Be Happening Soon
item.description:
Summary

  • The next Nintendo Direct may happen in late May or (more likely) early June 2025.
  • Nintendo hasn't missed an opportunity to hold a June Direct since first introducing this product showcase format in late 2011.
  • The next Nintendo Direct is expected to include multiple 2025 release date announcements.

A new report from a well-known industry insider suggests that a new Nintendo Direct is happening really soon, likely around the time of the Switch 2 launch. The event itself is expected to feature multiple release date announcements and won't necessarily be focused on Nintendo's next console.

This prediction comes from Pedro Henrique Lutti Lippe, a Brazilian journalist also known as PH Brazil. In recent years, Lippe shared several credible insights into the inner workings at Nintendo. Most notably, he was the first to break the story that the Switch 2 would be released in 2025—a report made at a time when most industry watchers were forecasting a 2024 launch.

During a late May 2025 livestream, Lippe predicted that the next Nintendo Direct will happen in the near future, predicting it's set to take place either on the week of May 26 or the one right after—as first picked up by Famiboards user Dan. The claim suggests that Nintendo's next product showcase could be planned for around the time of the Switch 2 launch, which is scheduled for June 5. However, that isn't to say that the rumored June 2025 Nintendo Direct will be focused on Switch 2 games.

Multiple 2025 Switch Games Are Still Waiting for Release Dates

Seeing how multiple 2025 Switch games are still waiting for release dates, Nintendo is more likely to get those announcements out of the way prior to holding another Direct that's entirely focused on its next console, whose overall launch lineup has been largely established since early April. The current list of high-profile 2025 Switch games without confirmed release dates includes Pokemon Legends: Z-A , Metroid Prime 4: Beyond , and Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment .

As for Switch 2 games, a June 2025 Nintendo Direct would serve as an opportunity for the Japanese gaming giant to further showcase the likes of Mario Kart World and Donkey Kong Bananza —assuming it takes place before the new console hits the market. Some game announcements are also a possibility, not least because of Nintendo's historical tendency to reveal new titles during the third quarter of the year.

A June 2025 Nintendo Direct Is a Fairly Safe Bet

Looking at broader trends, a June 2025 Nintendo Direct looks like a fairly safe bet. Since first introducing its video product showcases in late 2011, Nintendo has never missed an opportunity to hold at least one such event in June. Between 2012 and 2024, the company has averaged exactly two June product showcases per year. While some of them were Pokemon Presents events, the majority were Nintendo Directs.

item.title: Persona 5 Royal Gift Guide (Best P5R Gifts)
item.description:
Persona 5 Royal expands on the original game in a number of meaningful ways, helping to turn what's already a truly fantastic title into one of the best JRPGs in recent memory. One standout improvement can be seen through the way that Joker interacts with his confidants, with players now able to give P5R gifts to both male and female characters to help boost their bond.

Choosing the right gift can help deepen Joker's relationship with a confidant, unlocking new scenes and story moments along the way. Maxing out a confidant also unlocks their ultimate Persona, which is why finding the best gifts is so important. This Persona 5 Royal gift guide can help in that regard, with recommendations tailored to every confidant in the game.

  • Akechi Ann Chihaya
    Futaba Haru Hifumi
    Iwai Kawakami Makoto
  • Maruki Ohya Ryuji
    Shinya Sojiro Takemi
    Yoshizawa Yusuke

All of the gift recommendations in this P5R gift guide grant a +3 boost unless otherwise stated.

The Best Gifts for Akechi in Persona 5 Royal

Justice Arcana

  • Electric Toothbrush (¥29,800 from Akindo Electronics Superstore)
  • Face Beautifier (¥9,800 from Akindo Electronics Superstore)
  • Luxury Aroma Set (¥3,800 from Body Chop Cosmetics Store)
  • Omni-Vitamin (¥4,500 from Rocinante Discount Store)
  • Robot Vacuum (¥44,800 from Akindo Electronics Superstore)
  • Silver Bangle (¥68,000 from Tsurukame Diamond Jewelry Store)

Although not essential, players should aim to reach Rank 8 of Akechi's confidant before November 18.

The Best Gifts for Ann in Persona 5 Royal

Lovers Arcana

All of the Persona 5 Royal gifts will be restocked on the first day of each month.

The Best Persona 5 Royal Gifts for Every Confidant

Trying to decide what to do with all of the P5R gifts can be tricky, particularly with certain characters only liking a handful of things. For example, it makes more sense to give the Star Mirror to Chihaya than to Ann, as there are eight gifts that they could give to Ann to gain a +3 boost, but only three that they could give to Chihaya. Similarly, as Yusuke is the only person to gain a +3 boost from a Watercolor Postcard, players should give him one of those before giving him a gift that would work well with one of the other P5R confidants.

The table below should make it much easier to spot these kinds of conflicts, although players will also need to factor pricing into their decisions, as some of the gifts in Persona 5 Royal are a lot more expensive than others and thus offer poor value for money. This is especially true of the electronic items from Akindo, which players should only ever buy if they're really struggling to raise a bond before a deadline.

48-Sided 3D Puzzle

Bath of Roses

Black Mug

Blaring Alarm Clock

Book Cover

Castella

Crimson Lipstick

Cup Noodle Set

Designer Perfume

Digital Camera
